edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL

Class UserInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL.UserInterface

  • public class UserInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    User interface is inteded to display and run the game in a text format for the user. Its sole purpose is to gather all of the data from the engine class and determines how to display the information onto the screen for the player, or user to look at. Not only this, the interface can also call upon the save and load methods for the intention of saving at crucial points of the game.
    Author:
    Mario Garcia, Anuja Joshi, Michelle Duoung, Matthew Musquiz, Kristin Adachi

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Engine engine
      Engine class that the interface cannot run without.
      private java.util.Scanner kb
      This object calls for to scan the keyboard and the input that the user sends to the program.
      private java.util.Random rm
      The random class is used as a helper for the aid in displaying random quotes after the player is brutally killed by an enemy.
      private SaveLoad saveLoad
      This class is intended to call upon its save and load methods in order to record the progress of the player in his/her game.

    • Field Detail

      • saveLoad

        private SaveLoad saveLoad
        This class is intended to call upon its save and load methods in order to record the progress of the player in his/her game.

      • rm

        private java.util.Random rm
        The random class is used as a helper for the aid in displaying random quotes after the player is brutally killed by an enemy.

      • engine

        private Engine engine
        Engine class that the interface cannot run without. This class is used as a beacon for information, where the interface uses this object to gather information on the status of the game and the current situation the player, enemies, document, and power ups are currently located at.

      • kb

        private java.util.Scanner kb
        This object calls for to scan the keyboard and the input that the user sends to the program.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserInterface

        public UserInterface()

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display(int number)
        Displays a string representation of the game grid, by which it uses the current locations of all of the objects inside as coordinates in which it can place the symbol of that object.
        Parameters:
        number - - This variable is user input, which is used to determine the direction the player wants to look into.

      • debugDisplay

        public void debugDisplay(int number)
        Displays a string representation of the game grid, by which it uses the current locations of all of the objects inside as coordinates in which it can place the symbol of that object. This display method is also used to debug the game, so it will reveal the enemy locations, powerups, and document locations on the grid. Not only this, the entire grid display will not be covered in the "X" fog. To debug the program ingame, enter 42.
        Parameters:
        number - - This variable is user input, which is used to determine the direction the player wants to look into.

      • startMenu

        public void startMenu()
        The menu of the game, this is what the player will see in the first point of the game. Not only this, the player is given the choice to load a previous save, quit the game, or start up a new game.

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
        This method is where the game begins, everything that makes the game possible starts here. The interface fully interacts with the game engine, it also gathers information from the player, and it determines how to display the grid, by the user's choice.
